Name: Starry is the Night
QuestDesc: The always calm Roccia reaches out to you with an urgent request. Go to the Strand and check on the banished "pilgrims."

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you mind dropping by the Strand when you have time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Umm... Brant and Bardolino are away, and they put me in charge of the welcoming proceedings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm feeling a bit nervous about it. Part of me just wants to crawl into my box... Pero is all stressed out because of me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I tend to fumble with words when talking to people... I'm worried I won't do a good job accommodating everyone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Laureate {Male=himself;Female=herself} were here, I wouldn't be so nervous. It would make things easier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, {PlayerName}, as our new Laureate, we need your help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time to shine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't hold back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for coming, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone's a bit shaken... We weren't at our best...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not nervous, afraid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone got scared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most of us in the troupe have had bad run-ins with Tacet Discords. They just can't shake the fear, no matter how many times we face them. Not everyone's like you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero and I weren't sure if we could keep everyone safe. But watching you in action, it hit me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Action beats worrying any day. It's like tightrope walking. Just keep moving forward and never look down. That's the trick to staying steady.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone's safe now, thanks to you. We should get these pilgrims back to the troupe before more Tacet Discords show up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm-hmm, all these people are pilgrims. They've had a tough time drifting here on the Pilgrim's Sail.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fenrico may be a phony hiding behind a mask, but I'm sure he wouldn't go back on his word as Primus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you're the new Laureate, I doubt we'll see any more banishments.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Pilgrim's Sail probably left Ragunna before Fenrico gave his word.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do hope this is the last of its kind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You repel the Tacet Discords, saving both the pilgrims and the troupe members.
Roccia thanks you and explains the origins of the pilgrims.

Dialogues.Speaker: Frowning Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ack... Ugh... My hand...

Dialogues.Speaker: Frowning Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It hurts... like hell. I think it's broken...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roccia asks the young man to hold still, before treating him with some medicine Pero has taken out from her box.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero says sorry. This is the best we can do for now with the supplies we have.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll take better care of your injury once we're back at our base. Please try to bear with it for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Weak Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... Huh? I'm... still alive?

Dialogues.Speaker: Weak Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good... I'm alive... Good...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The elderly man's belly growls as he speaks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Weak Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, please excuse me... I haven't eaten in days...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roccia instructs Pero to bring out some water and rations from her box for the elderly man.

Dialogues.Speaker: Recovered Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, thank you... This is the best meal I've had since boarding that ship.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero says there'll be more tasty treats waiting for you back at our base.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Together, you and Roccia rescue the pilgrims.
Some are badly injured, others are starving, and none are in good shape.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Umm, these guys seem in bad shape...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're almost done counting heads, First Mate. You ready to head back?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You guys go ahead with our new members. I'll stay behind for another sweep to see if we missed anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we can't just leave you here by yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay, Pero and I do scavenger hunts all the time. We'll be fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The captain handed me the reins before he left... People's lives are at stake, I can't afford to mess up.

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, I got Roccia covered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, the Laureate. How could I forget? Then I guess Roccia is in safe hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, make your way back as soon as you're done, okay? I got kitchen duty today. I'll make sure a big bowl of pasta is waitin' for ya!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go over the cabins again. Door by door.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The pilgrims need better shelter, so Tina takes them back to the troupe.
Roccia volunteers to stay behind for a final checkup, and you decide to accompany her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sometimes items get left behind, like Luceanites buried deep beneath the sand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some people aren't here anymore, but their stuff's still around. If they brought it all the way on the Pilgrim's Sail, it must have mattered a lot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Things tend to hold onto memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll make sure to keep those memories safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero... pero?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like Pero has found something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's faint... but there's still hope. Pero, come help her up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, Pero is very gentle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The group returns to the Troupe with Pero carrying the dying girl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero discovers a dying little girl in the cabin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roccia and Pero help the little girl rest in a medical tent and perform emergency treatment on her. Once her condition stabilizes, Roccia takes you to Tina to let her know you’ve returned safe and sound. Meanwhile, Pero stays behind in the tent to keep an eye on the girl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What took you so long? Come on, grab a big bowl of pasta while it's still steamin'.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Give it to {PlayerName}, I'll eat later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roccia remarks as she hurries back to the tent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here. Dig in.

Options.PlotLineKey: It can wait. I'll go see if Roccia needs anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You accept the bowl of pasta from Tina. The homecooked flavors seem especially comforting in the moment.
Maybe it's because of all the energy you burned earlier, or maybe food just tastes better when enjoyed with company.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You put down the plate and go inside the tent to help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll come with you. I'm sure they'd appreciate the extra hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll come with you. I'm sure they'd appreciate the extra hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You return to the troupe, where Tina is preparing pasta.
Meanwhile, Roccia is busy patching up the little girl. You decide to go lend a hand.

Chapters.Title: Tend to the little girl in the tent

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What?! She's still alive?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, I didn't mean it like that! Back when we checked the ship's cabins, we thought she was already...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, I can't believe myself right now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's all right. We can still save her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should disinfect her wounds before removing the splinters... No rush, nice and steady.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tina and Roccia manage to treat the little girl's wounds. Her breathing gradually steadies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew... that was close.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's past the worst part. She'll recover soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about the others, Tina?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All fed and steadily recovering.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even though they're just kinda staring at the ground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, they've been drifting at sea for so many days, and now they've washed up somewhere completely new.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're like a sponge that's been soaked in water. All heavy and waterlogged. It'll take a while for them to bounce back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you think we should do...?

Options.PlotLineKey: Why don't we try talking to them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. We should see if anyone needs anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Roccia carefully tends to the little girl. She then asks about the condition of the other pilgrims.
Tina informs you two that the others have been fed and are recovering from their injuries, though they remain mentally drained.
You encourage the introverted Roccia to ask the pilgrims directly about their well-being and explore how else she can help.

Chapters.Title: Ask the young man if he needs anything

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feeling much better. Thanks for patching me up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Filippo's hand is now covered in bandages and is no longer swollen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those pain relievers you used are from Rosemary's Apothecary, right? My family used to live not far from them. I'd recognize that smell anywhere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sometimes I think about home. Other times, I'd rather not.

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I miss my soft couch and the smell of herbs wafting from the apothecary. But those Order activities? Those boring plays full of Codex verses? No thanks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know, I bet if the Blessed Maiden were still around, she'd loathe this form of penitance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "A thousand stars light up the air. Freedom blooms like flowers wide." That was her favorite line from an opera.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's a line from Pegasus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. It's about a world where people can choose their own beliefs instead of blindly following some rigid creed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mandatory gatherings, worship, enforced codes of conduct... They even dictate what plays we can watch and how we should laugh and smile.

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I want to go home, I really do... but Ragunna isn't the same place anymore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: During our so-called pilgrimage, people played lunachords and flutes. Everyone on board gathered around a "star" to sing opera and uplift each other's spirits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In those moments, I felt that as long as we could sing freely together, the Pilgrim's Sail could become my new home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But as we drifted farther out to sea, we faced more dangers, and fewer of us survived. Even our instruments got wrecked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And now... there's no way to perform again with what's left of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm lost now. Nowhere to go, and no home to return to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The brief smile that once graced his lips has vanished, leaving his face shrouded in sadness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Filippo’s arm has mostly recovered, but he remains deeply depressed.
He recounts how Ragunna, under the Order's rule, strictly regulated theatrical performances.
He and others were exiled for performing the banned opera, "Pegasus."
During their exile, many of their companions perished in perilous encounters, leaving the survivors unable to continue the beloved opera.

Chapters.Title: Ask the elderly man if he needs anything

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, sir. Are you feeling better?

Dialogues.Speaker: Giulio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Much better. Thank you for the pasta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Giulio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, that warmth… that taste of home. For a moment there, I thought I was dreaming.

Dialogues.Speaker: Giulio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It took me back to Margherita's, having the usual from their brunch menu... Oh, that's something I thought I'd get to enjoy for the rest of my life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Giulio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... here I am, simply because I sang a few lines from Pegasus...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pegasus. I see...

Dialogues.Speaker: Giulio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right. Folks on the ship used to perform together, letting the day's mood pick the song. Just had to keep an eye out for the Order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Giulio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That one was an all-time favorite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you ever get tired of it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Giulio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Get tired of it? No, why would we do that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Giulio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a real gem, that one. Lifted everyone's spirits during the hard times.

Dialogues.Speaker: Giulio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If only the world were like that, where everyone lives freely. I wouldn't have to endure so much at this age...

Dialogues.Speaker: Giulio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They called it a "pilgrimage," but Tacet Discords pursued us the entire journey... We lost so many. The truth is clear to everyone now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Giulio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sigh I survived, while so many young souls did not...

Dialogues.Speaker: Giulio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't even have the strength to take their cherished belongings with me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Giulio, another exile, shares his longing for the freedom celebrated in "Pegasus" and his deep nostalgia for his departed partner.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone has been through so much...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All those rules on how to live, forced exile, friends gone missing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is there anything we can do to cheer them up?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, pain relievers are a start. We've already handed those out. That'll help with the physical pain part.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: True, food is always an essential. But bellies are full, and spirits are still in the gutter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, what would I do without the Laureate around?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Medicine for the body, sure. But for the soul? We need something grand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone we talked to kept mentioning the Pegasus opera. Maybe we could arrange a little performance with them and their companions...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's decided then. The welcoming opera will be Pegasus.

Options.PlotLineKey: But most of their companions are already...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, traditionally the troupe always puts on a show for newly rescued pilgrims.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's our way of saying, "Congrats, you survived!" We hope it sets the tone for something better for them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, I know a way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero and I searched through the ship and found what must be their companions' belongings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some are a bit damaged, but nothing I can't fix. I'll patch them up and we'll use them in the performance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That way, they can be together again… on stage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After speaking with the pilgrims, Roccia concludes that their biggest wish is to perform "Pegasus" with their companions once again.
As a stage prop maker, Roccia resolves to collect and repair the objects left behind by her partners so she can participate in the welcoming opera alongside them.

Chapters.Title: Meet up with Roccia on stage and prepare for the play together

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A lunachord, a prop gun, ship debris, Luceanites...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you look at that! Well done, Pero.

Options.PlotLineKey: I didn't know Pero could carry so much.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not only that, Pero could swallow an entire ship if she wanted to. She can even analyze frequencies and give me the full backstory on all this stuff.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You see, objects carry people's thoughts and feelings. And what better way to share those than through an opera?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you think, {PlayerName}? When is someone really gone?

Options.PlotLineKey: When what they stood for fades away?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, there is some truth to that. But as long as Pero and I are here, whoever owned these items will never be forgotten.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, there is some truth to that. Unless, of course, you have a troupe like ours. We'll weave what they stood for into operas and pass them down. Their memories will live on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Beyond high walls we fly, through mist where dangers lie. Over wrecked bows and ships adrift, I chase the Golden Fleece's gift, under the North Star's light."

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If only life could be as grand as the opera scripts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, I'll fix these items up, give'em a good shine, and voilà—everyone gets to perform together again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roccia begins setting up the stage and preparing props for the welcoming opera. You help her inventory the items Pero brought back to determine how they can best be used.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequencies lingering in this lunachord tell me that its owner never stopped playing, not even during her exile.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She tried lifting everyone's spirits with song, right up until those nasty Tacet Discords got her...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now all that's left is this lunachord, minus the strings.

Options.PlotLineKey: The lunachord was used for helping others.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, she kept strumming away, supporting those around her...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, I've got an idea! Even without the right strings, we can rig up something else. It can still be used to help people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Roccia reflects on a lunachord left behind by the Pilgrim’s Sail.
Its owner sought to ease everyone’s hearts through music, and they performed till the last second of their life.
Though the lunachord has lost its strings, Roccia replaces them with something new, transforming it into a stage prop to inspire others.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These bits of ship debris may not look like much, but they were once part of countless Pilgrim's ships.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They carry all the fear and confusion people felt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But they also hold onto their strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm-hmm, this debris will make a good backdrop material.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or we can scatter them around the stage to help set the mood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, Pero. Let's get them up there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's nice of you, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the troupe doesn't make its honored guests carry heavy stuff.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Pero emerges out of her box and sweeps up the debris on the stage like a whirlwind under Roccia's command.
Through a process of disassembling, mixing, matching, and reassembling, the debris pieces transform into stage props.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There. That pretty much covers the basics.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Roccia reflects on the ship debris. These fragments once belonged to a Pilgrim's Sail—a vessel that carried everyone’s fear and confusion, while also recording their resilience and defiance.
The debris is large and well-suited for use as scene props for the stage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Luceanite can be found pretty much everywhere across the Strand, either buried in the sand or washed up by the tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Legends say each piece is a soul trapped in the Strand. After facing wind and rain, day after day, they start to lose their shine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to collect them before that happens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, the Luceanite's glitter is what makes them charming.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can use them as stars that shine in the night sky.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for where they fit onto our stage... Let's set them around the center.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After placing the Luceanites, Pero emerges from her box, extending countless tentacle-like arms. She scatters the Luceanites into the air and swiftly ties them with ribbons.
In quick succession, the dark stage is filled with brilliant sparkles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perfect. Now we have a glimmer of light to illuminate the darkness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Roccia shares with you the significance of Luceanites.
Legend has it that each Luceanite is a soul trapped on the Strand.
If left exposed in the wild, the stone loses its light and must be collected in time.
Bright Luceanites are ideal for creating star clusters to decorate stage ceilings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Flower petals... No, wait. They're pieces of a wreath.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The residual frequencies hint that it was once a little boy's favorite. He was shoved into a crowded cabin with no idea what he had done wrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He never survived the sail... He didn't grab the prop gun in time. The wreath got blown away, leaving only a few petals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These petals are very delicate. I need some time to think about how to work them into the opera. For now, I'll have Pero hold onto them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Roccia tells you about a petal—a fragment of a wreath that once belonged to a little boy who didn’t survive the shipwreck.
The petals are soft and fragile, and Roccia carefully considers how they might be incorporated into the welcoming opera.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All right. Now that all the items are in place, the stage is pretty much set up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}. I'm sure the sentiments tied to these items will make their grand entrance into everyone's hearts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... But I feel like we're still missing something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe the stage isn't bright enough? The North Star in Pegasus is the symbol of hope after all, so it should be brighter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember Filippo said that everyone used to gather under "star" and sing, but I didn't find any stars on the ship.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why don't we go ask him?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Maybe he can tell us more about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The initial stage setup is complete, but Roccia notices that the stars aren’t shining brightly enough.
The North Star, a symbol of hope in "Pegasus," should shine even brighter.
Roccia recalls Filippo mentioning that people sang under a star on the boat and decides to ask him for more information.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello again, Filippo. You mentioned before people would sing under a star on the Pilgrim's Sail, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, yes. I can still picture the star's brilliant glow in my head... It was just like the North Star in Pegasus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you know where that star is now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Filippo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The star was Luca's treasure. But Luca...

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? Pero says Luca is awake.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Filippo reveals that the star belonged to Luca. Pero, sensing that Luca may have woken up, goes to investigate.

Chapters.Title: Check on Luca in the tent

Dialogues.Speaker: Luca
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I lost Mom's special treasure...

Dialogues.Speaker: Luca
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The light from the star kept the darkness away. It looked after everyone when we were at sea...

Dialogues.Speaker: Luca
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We liked to sing around it, just like Mommy did in her plays.

Dialogues.Speaker: Luca
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She always said the star represents hope. It would keep me safe, and protect those around me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Luca
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: N-now I've lost it and it can't protect anyone anymore...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A frown begins to form on Roccia's face. She wants to comfort Luca but struggles to come up with the right words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero... Pero, pero!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero says you should rest up and we'll go find the star for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Luca
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-But it's too dangerous out there... You already saved me... And Mom said I shouldn't cause so much trouble for others.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, Luca, it's no trouble at all. You also have something important to do—rest and recover.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And just like you said, the star watches over everyone. We're doing it for everybody.

Dialogues.Speaker: Luca
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay... I'll be good and rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero can sense the frequencies of the "star" left on Luca.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that Pero is on the right scent, we can start our search.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Luca cries upon realizing her star is lost.
She believes it has always been the star that blessed everyone and that misfortune strikes when the star is gone.
You and Roccia comfort the weak Luca and promise to help her find the star.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We already searched the ship from top to bottom. There wasn't anything that looked like a star.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I still want to find it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want everyone to have the chance to perform Pegasus again...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the props we use should be items that they've all used before, things they're familiar with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequencies, or feelings, attached to the items can affect the people using them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They all see the star as a symbol of hope. This positive vibe will get magnified by the opera and spread to more people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So yeah, I'm still going to try and find it. There's always a chance, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A "chance" is just another way of saying "hope."

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Roccia search the ship but find no star-like objects.
Objects imbued with emotional frequencies resonate with their users, so Roccia decides to use familiar items to help the pilgrims.
She resolves to create a new "star" to perfect the "Pegasus" ensemble. For Roccia, "possibility" means "hope."

Chapters.Title: Go back to The Strand and find the star

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mist...

Options.PlotLineKey: The kind you played hide-and-seek in?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. The island is covered in mist most of the year.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I just cleared that area not too long ago. And with the latest weather, there shouldn't be any more mist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Battier's out fishing, like always, and our trusty "mist detector" Lario hasn't made a peep.

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe this mist is different from the one before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something about this feels uniquely suspicious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, the air is so humid. It's like the mist is standing right next to us, waving hello.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "A sea covered in veil, lay beasts of howling wail—"

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to Pegasus, we should be careful when there's mist close by.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to find the star before it rolls in...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like a piece of ship debris.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero can store it away. We'll put it to good use later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, it's a seashell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Clean the seashells, toss them in with some seaweed and salt, and ta-da—seashell soup.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pack this seashell in the suitcase.

Options.PlotLineKey: Didn't know the first mate was a chef.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, Pero taught me. I only know a few simple recipes though. You'll have to go to Pero for the fancy stuff.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone in the troup finds a way to pitch in, and I usually lend a hand with cooking, but Pero's better with the fancy stuff.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone loves the food Pero makes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You discover some clams.
The troupe isn't high on budget and often has to eat whatever they can find nearby.
Roccia takes the clams to make a pot of clam soup for everyone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Finally, something shiny...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, it's a Luceanite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, at least we managed to find something shiny, so that's half the battle...

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like Pero's found something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You find a Luceanite, which Roccia carefully stores away.
Meanwhile, Pero suddenly perks up, as if it's made an important discovery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero... pero!?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero said she's found the star's frequencies in these traces, but there's something else mixed in with them...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequencies are a jumbled mess. I can't tell them apart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Pero finds footprints that emit star frequencies, though they’re jumbled and hard to decipher.
You volunteer to investigate further.

Chapters.Title: Use the Sensor to help Rocia identify individual waveforms

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't know you were this smooth with identifying frequencies. I'm impressed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's like the mist has been waiting for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This isn't the usual hide-and-seek mist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As you venture deeper, the rising mist surrounds you, forming a maze.
The open door seem to invite you in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This misty maze is giving me déjà vu.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... A strange and suspicious smell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's familiar... but also different. Like a poorly done copy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Pegasus, the maze is woven from lies and malevolence. Inside, it's as chaotic and unpredictable as a misty sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's every kind of monster in there. At the heart of it all lurks an Archdemon, who's a master of all things evil. It steals, distorts reality, spreads confusion, and plays puppet master.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wonder if a fellow opera fan borrowed this scene from it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Umm, what kind of person would want to be the Archdemon?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, I do get why people want to be heroes. They're the stars of the show. But all this convoluted nonsense? Not exactly heroic.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A reasonable assumption.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether they're playing an Archdemon or a hero, after putting so much work into this whole setup, I'm sure they're expecting something in return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In an opera, you can get... hope and personal growth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or the power to deceive and manipulate.

Options.PlotLineKey: Only one way to find out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right. Let's go inside and see for ourselves what the mastermind behind this mess is really after.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Roccia realizes the misty maze resembles a scene from "Pegasus."
Together, you conclude that the maze must be man-made and decide to explore what lies within.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero!

Dialogues.Speaker: Monster?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roarrrr...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uhh... Stay sharp, Pero!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm here with you. Don't worry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Err... These frequencies are made up of deception and lies. They smell awful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero senses the "star" inside the cave and... something else she can't describe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're approaching the end of this path. It seems like the center of the maze is just ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Soon we'll find out what lies at the core.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... it may also be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right. We should keep going.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
At the end of the maze, you find a cavern shrouded in mist.
Inside, the pitch-black cavern is filled with stars and something you can't recognize.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nice and easy. We're right on track.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Thanks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia & Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eek!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay. We're nearly there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia & Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ack!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dragon of Dirge? No, wait.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's alright. They're just shadows.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. I'm not afraid.

Chapters.Title: Find the lost star with Roccia

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName} & Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cuddle Wuddle
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hoo hoo...

Dialogues.Speaker: Diggy Duggy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Coo coo...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lottie Lost & Hocus Pocus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Squeak squeak...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Err... Looks like they were trying to sneak away with the star, but hit the light switch by accident.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cuddle Wuddle
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hoo hoo... Hoo hoo!

Dialogues.Speaker: Diggy Duggy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Coo...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lottie Lost & Hocus Pocus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Squeak squeak!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What are they saying?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're saying, "We're not going down without a fight!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You venture into the cavern, and Roccia—who is usually calm—shows fear of the dark. With you by her side, she steadies herself.
Inside, the cavern opens into a wide space where a group of Plushie Echoes are busy at work.
Could this so-called "Demon King" really just be a bunch of Plushies?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Golden Fleece, a worn playbook, old instruments...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are they supposed to be the Archdemon?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or the Fools hiding from the Tacet Discords?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cuddle Wuddle
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hoo hoo...

Dialogues.Speaker: Diggy Duggy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Coo coo...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lottie Lost & Hocus Pocus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Squeak squeak... Squeak squeak...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Plushies are defeated, but they seem to have something they want to say.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are these Echoes the Archdemon in the opera?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, no. They're just abandoned Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They used to have homes and their own masters. They still don't understand why they got kicked out all of a sudden one day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even after being abandoned, they never forgot about their masters and managed to find their way home... but their masters were no longer there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They scoured the whole of Rinascita, refusing to give up and accept the truth... But even now, when they've reached this Land of the Banished, they still couldn't find a single trace of their masters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just when they were about to lose hope, they found solace in the emotional frequencies left on personal items.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So they made this place their home. Little by little, they scavenged things to bring the home from their memories to life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's how they came across the "star."

Options.PlotLineKey: Right when the Tacet Discords attacked the ship.
So they just snatched it and ran.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. They're not really the brawling type. The Tacet Discords scare them, so they sneak around, grabbing anything not nailed down while trying not to get caught.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With so many Tacet Discords wandering around the Strand, all they can do is scatter Golden Fleece, spooking the Tacet Discords to give them the chance to sneak out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're willing to risk it all to find trinkets to make this place... feel more like home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether you're a person or an Echo, everybody needs a place to call home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They heard the Pegasus opera from their masters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why they went for the star when they saw it rolling away. They wanted the good, hopeful frequencies it was radiating.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These Echoes knew the star wasn't theirs, but they weren't keen on giving it up, either. So they cooked up all those spooky tricks to scare us away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Turns out, this maze wasn't hiding an Archdemon or a hero. Just a bunch of Fools.

Options.PlotLineKey: Fools, huh? Let's welcome them to the Fool's Troupe then.
They want a home? They can join the troupe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good idea. Let's bring these Echoes along. Plus we could use some extra help with the opera.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And all this stuff they worked so hard to collect... Let's bring it with us too. It must mean a lot to them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
It turns out the Plushies are abandoned Echoes, and all they want is to reunite with their owners.
Even after reaching this desolate island, the Plushies couldn’t find their owners.
Instead, they take comfort in the emotional frequencies lingering on objects and begin piecing together "homes" from these fragments of memory. That’s how they discovered the "star."
Roccia believes both people and Echoes need a place to return to. You offer to bring the Plushies back to the Fool's Troupe with you.

Chapters.Title: Gather the item worth bringing back to the Troupe

Dialogues.Speaker: Lottie Lost
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Squeak squeak... Squeak...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She says this accordion was from her master.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even though she hasn't found her master yet, this accordion left her with many fond memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "As the mist fades, so shines the star's unbound light—"

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her master used to sing this to lift the spirits of people who had been wronged, and naturally, she picked up the tune.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The misty maze we just went through was her attempt to recreate the opera. She used the misty coastline as a stage, with the help of her Echo friends, of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I guess she was trying her best to protect all her memories with her master.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But protecting your own shouldn't come at the cost of everyone else's memories and hopes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For anyone who's been hurt, we're probably better off sticking together than dragging each other down, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Lottie Lost’s owner used to sing "Pegasus" to inspire those who suffered injustice, and Lottie learned it too.
The maze you encountered earlier was their attempt to recreate scenes from the play, blending the foggy seaside environment with its imagery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero and I are almost done packing everything up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shall we head back, {PlayerName}?

Options.PlotLineKey: I still need to check around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All right. Back to the troupe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay. We'll be here when you're ready.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roccia asks Pero to bring along the Echoes and their items as they all return to the Troupe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're back, First Mate. Don't worry, we've all been doing fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you look at that? Managed to bring back a few friends, did ya?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We did. Thank you for taking such good care of everything while I was away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't mention it. The troupe is in top shape after the last pit stop. We can handle a few more!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, the Echoes and I will get to work on setting up the stage. Trust me, any worries you have will melt away once we get busy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We found the star thanks to you. You should tell Luca the good news.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now we can finally perform Pegasus together. Nobody is going to be left out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You return to the troupe with the Plushies.
Roccia suggests letting them to help set up the stage. You tell Luca that her star has been found.

Chapters.Title: Tell Luca you've found the star

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You bring the star into Luca's tent.
Luca immediately gets up from her bed as she sees the familiar glow, her face brimming with happiness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Luca
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The star... The star's back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Luca
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, thank you, {Male=mister;Female=miss}! Now the star is here, I'll definitely get better!

Dialogues.Speaker: Luca
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm actually feeling much better already!

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you mind if we borrow the star?

Dialogues.Speaker: Luca
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go ahead. It's for the opera, right? I heard so much bustle outside while I was in bed. I figured they were preparing for a show.

Dialogues.Speaker: Luca
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girl with the purple hair said she wanted to use something really shiny as the North Star in Pegasus. Well, nothing beats this star!

Dialogues.Speaker: Luca
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now we can all sing together around the star again. It will be wonderful, just like it was back on the ship!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Luca, overjoyed, lets you lend her star for the welcoming opera.

Chapters.Title: Return to the stage. There's been a new development with the Plushies

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Echoes can gather all kinds of information by analyzing the frequencies left on objects.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On the stage, Lottie Lost found her master's old lunachord, Diggy Duggy found his master's wreath, Cuddle Wuddle found his master's favorite prop gun...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And Hocus Pocus hit the jackpot and found his master.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Turns out, their masters didn't actually abandon them after all.

Options.PlotLineKey: So their masters had their reasons?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Their masters were actually banished. All that's left of some are their belongings, but others were taken in by the troupe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their masters just didn't want their Echoes to be snatched up by the Order and have their memories wiped clean. Cutting ties was the only way to protect them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apparently, the real Archdemon isn't the Echoes that created the maze. It's the one pulling the strings behind all this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All the control, and all the arbitrary banishments...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A simple sentence from those higher-ups can ruin the peaceful lives of countless people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm-hmm, but now you've won the Laurel and forced Fenrico to finally back down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, I guess we're safe from banishments for a while, and the troupe can waltz back into Ragunna for performances.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which means our plays will finally be heard in a city drowning in those oh-so-exciting Codex recitals. Little by little, we'll sneak our songs back in…

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, the streets of Ragunna will be full of operas about freedom again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is what Brant and Bardolino have been preparing for lately. They sped off to the city as soon as they heard the news.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one loves their opera more than those two, and no one spins a tale quite like them... Except for the new Laureate, of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This welcoming opera also marks the beginning of a new voyage. It's not just an opera for the banished pilgrims. It's also dedicated to each and every Fool that is still out there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, Laureate, shall we go hang the North Star together and tell everyone the good news?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Back at the stage, the Plushies reveal a startling truth: their owners never abandoned them—they were exiled.
To protect their Echoes from the Order, which sought to erase their frequencies entirely, the owners made the painful decision to leave them behind.
At the theater, some Plushies are joyfully reunited with their owners, while others discover cherished items their owners once held dear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beyond high walls we fly

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Through mist where dangers lie

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But with courage, we shall find

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hope that frees the captive mind

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Il Matto?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Il Diavolo?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Truth and lies swirl in the haze

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Laureate seeks what hides in the maze

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The devil rules from heights afar

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where strings give way to springs of war

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Illusions rise beneath the sea

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The fool becomes the enemy

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But bubbles burst, with gun in hand

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To lend a light and make a stand

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Laureate's blade clears the snare

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A thousand stars light up the air

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Freedom blooms like flowers wide

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As hope, the North Star, is our guide

Chapters.Title: Go to the center stage and see what everyone is doing

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tina, your singing is as beautiful as ever. Thank you for lending us your voice for this revised version of Pegasus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahh thanks. I had to belt it out if I wanted to do Luca's shining North Star justice!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She can't make it up the stage, so I'll just have to bring the star to her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lottie Lost, here's your master's lunachord. It's missing its strings, but it can still help people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lottie Lost
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Squeak... Squeak squeak...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Diggy Duggy, this is your master's wreath. I got it patched up for you. Be sure to keep it somewhere safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Diggy Duggy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Coo coo!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The prop gun your master left behind, Cuddle Wuddle. It can blow bubbles now. Please take good care of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cuddle Wuddle
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hoo hoo!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
One by one, Roccia takes down the stage props and returns them to the audience. Items in hand, the audience departs feeling content.
Only a single Luceanite is left on the stage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After the show, Roccia returns the borrowed stage props to their rightful owners.
The audience leaves, satisfied with their reclaimed belongings.
As the stage empties, only one Luceanite remains.

Chapters.Title: Talk to Roccia about the Luceanite left

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great. Most of the items are returned to their rightful owners. Only a Luceanite left.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And it belongs to Roccia.

Options.PlotLineKey: You really do have a thing for Luceanite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. That's because I used to be one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You recognize it as Roccia’s Luceanite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}, for that wonderful performance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It took everybody to make it happen. And that includes you, of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since we first met, Pero and I noticed something special about your frequency. So special that even Pero couldn't figure it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ever since you came to Rinascita, the misty maze has been... unraveling.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe, just maybe... You can be the one to change things, no—Change the fate of the entire Solaris.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wherever you go, things start changing. Strange, wonderful things. You're like a magnet for the unpredictable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know the saying, with great power comes great responsibility. Danger will be hot on your heels wherever you go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, umm... why don't you join the Troupe of Fools?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You pulled off the perfect welcoming opera and marked a new voyage. We've been on the same side for awhile now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's all right... You can join us whenever you want. It's up to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you ever find yourself in a pickle, just come find us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The troupe will always have your back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We all started out banished to this deserted island. Bit by bit, we scrounged up what we could and built our home. That's how the troupe was formed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We may not be rich or perfect, but at least we can sing and laugh whenever we feel like it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And thanks to you, we've got the chance to bring that laughter and freedom back to Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like how your performance as Laureate with the Star of Hope cheered up our entire troupe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're the one who helped rekindle the hope in our hearts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Roccia, sensing something different in you, invites you to join the Fool’s Troupe.
Together, you performed the perfect welcoming opera, giving everyone the freedom to bring laughter back to Ragunna.
Your ideals and the troupe’s ideals align, making them your steadfast allies and support.

Dialogues.Speaker: Childhood Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beyond high walls, where dangers lie...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To the left, Pero.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks for everything, {PlayerName}! My first time running the welcoming proceedings was a hit, and the troupe's voyage back to Ragunna is off to a great start, if I do say so myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that the weight is off my shoulders, I feel light enough to pull off a few backflips.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem... Anyway, I think it's time we talk about that reward of yours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aside from the not-so-basic payment, I've got a little something extra just for you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Roccia dives herself into Pero's box and carefully rummages towards the bottom. She then returns with a unique-looking Luceanite.
The dark stone is adorned with golden veins shimmering with brilliance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here... I've been searching for this in the sand for ages. A golden-black Luceanite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Generally, the deeper it's buried, the better it is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think you and this Luceanite have a few things in common. It's as deep and beautiful as your eyes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Keep it with you when you're traveling. It'll be like I'm there with you, even when I'm not.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... if you ever find yourself in a pinch, don't be shy about giving us a shout.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether Pero has to give me a lift or I sail all the way on the troupe liner, I'll find a way to reach you as soon as I can.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Thanks to your efforts, Roccia’s first orientation and return-to-sail event was a success.
In addition to paying you for lending a hand, Roccia has a special gift for you.
